name: Shradheya Atal Bihari Vajpayee Botanical Garden

footer.copyright: Copyright 2024. Shradheya Atal Bihari Vajpayee Botanical Garden, All Rights Reserved.

body.bold1: Shradheya Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Botanical Garden
body.part2: , we are dedicated to inspiring a love for nature and promoting environmental stewardship. Established on 15/03/2024, our garden has grown into a vibrant sanctuary where visitors can explore a diverse collection of plants from around the world. Our mission is to educate, conserve, and connect people with the beauty and importance of the natural world. Whether you're here to learn, relax, or simply enjoy the scenery, we offer a welcoming space for everyone to experience the wonders of nature.

learn.name: Learn
learn.body: Engage with Visapur's vibrant community of horticulturists, botanists, and environmental educators.

ourStoryText.part1: Discover the transformative tale of the
ourStoryText.bold1: Shraddhey Shree Atal Bihari Vajpayee Botanical Garden
ourStoryText.bold2: Forest Department of Central Chanda, Maharashtra
ourStoryText.part4: In a bid to safeguard the delicate balance between human livelihoods and wildlife conservation, this expansive
ourStoryText.part5: was established, featuring a Conservation Zone nurturing indigenous flora and fauna, and a Recreation Zone offering educational and recreational experiences. Embracing eco-tourism and sustainable practices, this botanical marvel symbolizes India's commitment to harmonious coexistence, weaving together development, preservation, and environmental stewardship under PM Modi's 'Viksit Bharat' vision. It's a story of
ourStoryText.bold5: unity, progress, and the nurturing of a sustainable future

history.name: History
history.title: Discover the story behind Visapur Garden.
history.text: Nestled near the bustling Chandrapur Ballarpur National Highway No. 930, the Shradheya Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Botanical Garden, Visapur, unfolds as a serene oasis of nature and biodiversity. Spanning an impressive 108 hectares, this botanical garden stands as a beacon of biodiversity conservation and environmental education, drawing visitors from near and far.

mission.name: Mission

title.part2: empower and uplift the livelihoods of local artisans, preserve heritage, and celebrate diverse cultures.

mission.text: Through our commitment to ethical sourcing, fair trade practices, and collaborative partnerships with artisans, we aim to create sustainable opportunities that enable communities to thrive economically while preserving their traditional crafts and cultural heritage. By supporting local artisans, we not only promote economic empowerment but also contribute to the preservation of centuries-old traditions, fostering pride and sustainability within communities.

vision.name: Vision

title.part2: cultivate a vibrant and inclusive community
title.part4: shares a deep appreciation for nature, craft, and culture.

vision.text: We aspire to create a platform where individuals from all walks of life can come together to learn, inspire, and celebrate the rich story of global heritage. Through immersive experiences, educational initiatives, and interactive events, we envision fostering a deeper connection to the natural world and diverse cultural traditions. By building bridges between people and cultures, we aim to create a world where the beauty of artisanal craftsmanship and cultural diversity is cherished, respected, and celebrated by all.

initiatives.name: Initiatives
initiatives.title: Discover how our garden is at the forefront of promoting art, culture and conservation.

nearbyPlaces.name: Near by Places
nearbyPlaces.title: Witness the historical and cultural grandeur of the city

newsUpdates.title: News & Updates
newsUpdates.body: Stay up-to-date with the latest happenings at our botanical garden! From seasonal blooms and new plant collections to upcoming events, workshops, and conservation initiatives, this is your go-to source for all garden news. Explore our latest research projects, volunteer opportunities, and eco-friendly practices that help us grow greener every day. Don't miss out on exclusive garden tours, community programs, and special promotions.

guides.title: Our Guides
guides.body: Our passionate and knowledgeable guides are dedicated to enhancing your experience by sharing their expertise and love for nature. With a deep understanding of the garden's flora, history, and ecology, they are here to educate, inspire, and help you connect with the beauty and serenity of our natural spaces.

team.title: Our Team
team.body: Our dedicated team of higher authorities, horticulturists, botanists, and nature enthusiasts work together to cultivate and preserve the beauty of our garden. With a deep love for plants and the environment, we are committed to nurturing biodiversity, educating the community, and creating a tranquil space for visitors to connect with nature

join.title: We're looking for talented people to join us!
join.body: Join the team of Visapur Garden and become a part of a dynamic community that values creativity, innovation and preservation of our rich heritage.

garden.title: Garden's FAQ
garden.body:
This e-ticket is valid only for the number of persons in total and other permissions specified herein.
 This e-ticket has to be carried by the visitor to get the entry in the garden. Please take care of your ticket and QR.
 Without a QR code, you can not enter.
 Please keep the ticket safely till the end of the trip.
 Please show the ticket at the time of checking.
 Online Ticket Facility opens everyday from 4:30am and remains open till 9:00pm, everyday.
 Please check your ticket thoroughly. If you believe there is any mistake, we request you to read the 'Privacy Policy, Terms and Conditions.'
 If you have booked multiple tickets (more than 1), via online/ offline counter, you will still recieve only one QR code. Therefore, only one QR is sufficient for all and you do not need to carry/ scan multiple QR codes.
 One ticket is valid for a 'single scan'. Therefore, you cannot use the same QR code again.
 Please come in a queue before gatekeeper scans the QR.
 Please take care of all your belongings.
 Please keep the area clean. A spot fine of INR 500 will be imposed for spitting and throwing waste(whatsoever)
 Consuming alcohol in the premises is a 'punishable' offense.
 Bringing weapons and hazardous substances is a 'punishable' offense.

rules.title: Visapur Garden Service Rules & Regulations
rules.body:
The Botanical Garden is a place for teaching, research and plant species conservation. It is also a place of rest and recreation. To keep it this way, we kindly ask you to observe the following: 
 - Do not touch or consume plants. Certain plants in the Botanical Garden are poisonous or prickly. 
 - As parents or guardians, keep an eye on your children (the Garden is not a playground: no running, no hide-and-seek and the like). 
 - Picking, damaging, removing plants, plant parts, fruits or seeds is prohibited. 
 - Catching or releasing animals is prohibited. 
 - Entering planted areas, climbing trees, walls or rocks is prohibited. 
 - Bringing pets is prohibited. Assistance dogs are exempt. 
 - Bicycles and skateboards may not be brought into the garden. 
 - Filming or photography for commercial purposes is only allowed with written permission from the garden management. 
 - Photography for private purposes is allowed. 
 - Begging, busking, and art performances are prohibited. 
 - Please dispose of waste in the trash cans provided. 
 - Smoking is prohibited in the greenhouses and buildings. 
 - University management may ban individuals who repeatedly violate garden order. 
 - Garden staff is entitled to expel persons who violate the garden rules or disturb the peace in the garden and/or report them to the police.

photography.title: Garden's Photography Guidelines
photography.body:
Photographs are a wonderful way to remember your visit to the Gardens. We encourage you to take keepsake photos for personal use. To ensure a positive experience for all our visitors, please be aware of the following rules and guidelines established by the Shradheya Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Botanical Garden.
 The Gardens does not take reservations for wedding and portrait photo sessions.
 Photography equipment must be limited to phone camera only. Tripods, reflectors, and stand-alone flashes are prohibited.
 Props including furniture, helium balloons, and confetti are prohibited. Pets are also not allowed in the Gardens.
 Wardrobe changes are not allowed in the Gardens or our facilities, restrooms, or parking lot.
 Please do not sit or walk in any planted, mulched, or wooded area. Always stay on paths and turf areas.
 Please do not injure, disturb, damage, deface, or remove any plant, garden feature, rock, artwork, bird, animal, insect, or structure for any reason.
 Please do not climb up, walk on, or otherwise abuse trees, shrubs, plants, fences, walls, boulders, or other garden features.
 Please do not play any audio equipment such as radios, CD, DVD, or MP3 players out loud.
 Please do not solicit, except with written permission from the Birmingham Park & Recreation Board.
 Friendly Reminders
 Please be courteous and do not block pathways or other access areas in any way while capturing your keepsake photos. Remember that the Gardens is a public place where visitors are welcome in all public areas, and that regular business continues during normal operating hours. Be sure to lock your vehicle and avoid leaving items of value in your car during your visit.
 Thank you for choosing the Gardens for your wedding, family, and individual portraits!

body.part1: Step into a world of natural beauty at our botanical garden, where every visitor can explore, learn, and connect with the wonders of nature. Whether you're visiting with friends, family, or colleagues, we offer group tours, workshops, and customized activities for an unforgettable experience. Students can engage in hands-on learning, discovering vibrant ecosystems and sustainable practices. Seniors can enjoy peaceful walking paths and low-impact gardening workshops, while kids can embark on interactive adventures through scavenger hunts and planting activities.
body.part2: For influencers, the garden offers stunning backdrops, perfect for creating content, while nature enthusiasts will find a haven of rare species, themed gardens, and seasonal blooms. If you're seeking a moment of calm, our serene landscapes provide the ideal retreat from daily life. With accessible paths, an interactive map, and various activities, there's something for everyone to enjoy at our botanical garden.

whatWeOffer.title: What We Offer
whatWeOffer.thankYouText: Atal Botanical Garden is not just a place to visit, but a space to learn, wonder, and connect with the natural world. We look forward to welcoming everyone to this haven of knowledge and exploration!

support.supportText: We welcome your inquiries, feedback, and suggestions. Connect with us to learn more about our offerings, plan your visit, or share your experiences. Our team is here to assist you and ensure your journey through nature is unforgettable. Reach out today, and let's explore the beauty of the natural world together. Your adventure awaits!

address.part1: Shradheya Atal Bihari Vajpayee Botanical Garden,

planVisit.name: Plan Your Visit
planVisit.body: We offer a serene escape into the world of flora and fauna. Discover rare plants, enjoy scenic walks, and immerse yourself in the beauty of nature.

africanCichlids.descrp: With over 500 species found across Africa's Lakes Victoria, Malawi, and Tanganyika, this fish grows up to 6 inches, thrives at 23°C-28°C, and feeds on vegetables.

albinoRainbowShark.text: Hi! I am Albino Rainbow Shark
albinoRainbowShark.descrp: This vibrant fish from Southeast Asia, known for its active swimming behavior, grows up to 6 inches, thrives at 24°C-28°C, and feeds on algae.

albinoTigerShark.text: Hi! I am Albino Tiger Shark
albinoTigerShark.descrp: This Thailand and Vietnam native, known for hatching eggs internally and giving live birth, grows up to 2 feet, thrives at 20°C-28°C, and feeds on algae and blood worms.

alligatorGar.descrp: The largest species in the gar family, this fish grows up to 4 feet and is found in both North and South America, thriving at 24°C-29°C.

arapaima.descrp: Among the largest freshwater fish globally, this Amazon River Basin giant grows up to 10 feet, thrives at 26°C-30°C, and feeds on fish and crawfish.

arowana.descrp: This Asian fish, with an upturned mouth for surface breathing and feeding, grows up to 4 feet, thrives at 24°C-29°C, and feeds on fish and crustaceans.

bandedLiporinus.descrp: This fish, native to Brazil and Colombia, is yellow with nine thick black vertical stripes when mature, grows up to 1 foot, thrives at 24°C-30°C, and feeds on algae and blood worms.

blackGhost.descrp: This South American fish, using electric receptors to locate prey, grows up to 2 feet, thrives at 24°C-28°C, and feeds on algae and blood worms.

bloodRedParrot.text: Hi! I am Blood Red Parrot
bloodRedParrot.descrp: This tank-bred hybrid, with teeth deep near its throat, grows up to 1 foot, thrives at 25°C-29°C, and feeds on vegetables and blood worms.

dragonEel.descrp: This Indo-Pacific fish, known for its snake-like body and striking coloration, thrives at 24°C-28°C, feeds on small fish and crustaceans, and exhibits variable growth.

filamentalBarb.descrp: This Indo-Pacific fish, characterized by long, flowing filaments extending from its fins, grows up to 12 inches, thrives at 24°C-28°C, and feeds on small fish and crustaceans.

giantGourami.descrp: This fish, native to Thailand, Malaysia, and Cambodia, has a labyrinth organ functioning like a human lung, grows up to 2 feet, thrives at 24°C-30°C, and feeds on algae and blood worms.

koiCarp.descrp: This fish, native to China and Japan, can live for over 200 years if raised in proper conditions, grows up to 2 feet, thrives at 10°C-20°C, and feeds on algae and blood worms.

milkyKoi.descrp: This variant of Koi, known for its milky white color, grows up to 2 feet, originates from Japan, thrives at 10°C-20°C, and feeds on algae.

oscarFish.descrp: This South American fish, growing up to 1 foot, creates suction by rapidly expanding its mouth to suck in smaller organisms, feeding on vegetables and river shrimp, and thriving at 22°C-28°C.

rainbowShark.descrp: This fish from Southeast Asia, known for its distinctive red fins and active nature, grows up to 6 inches, thrives at 24°C-28°C, and feeds on algae.

redBelliedPacu.text: Hi! I am Red Bellied Pacu
redBelliedPacu.descrp: The Amazonian fish, originating from South America, has square, human-like teeth, grows up to 2 feet in length, thrives in temperatures between 22°C and 28°C, and feeds on fruits and bite-sized vegetables.

redBelliedPiranha.text: Hi! I am Red Bellied Piranha
redBelliedPiranha.descrp: This Guyanese fish, growing up to 1 foot, thrives at 24°C-28°C and feeds on fish, prawns, and fins nipped from larger fish.

redDevil.descrp: This tank-bred hybrid, with teeth deep down near its throat, grows up to 1 foot, thrives at 25°C-29°C, and feeds on vegetables and blood worms.

redTailCatfish.text: Hi! I am Red Tail Catfish
redTailCatfish.descrp: This active and aggressive predator from South America grows up to 4 feet, thrives at 24°C-29°C, and feeds on fish and crustaceans.

redTailShovelnoseCatfish.text: Hi! I am Red Tail Shovelnose Catfish
redTailShovelnoseCatfish.descrp: This South American fish, known for its striking red tail and aggressive behavior, grows up to 4 feet, thrives at 24°C-29°C, and feeds on fish and crustaceans.

severum.descrp: This African fish, known for its vibrant colors and striking patterns, grows up to 1 foot, thrives at 24°C-30°C, and feeds on algae.

shortFinEel.text: Hi! I am Short Fin Eel
shortFinEel.descrp: This Indo-Pacific fish, known for its long, snake-like body, grows up to 2 feet, thrives at 24°C-28°C, and feeds on small fish and crustaceans.

shovelnoseCatfish.descrp: This South American predator, territorial and aggressive, grows up to 4 feet, thrives at 24°C-29°C, feeds on fish and crustaceans, and is compatible with catfish.

sunCatfish.descrp: This Southern Indian fish, with a large head, wide mouth, and visible eyes from below, grows up to 18 inches, thrives at 24°C-28°C, feeds on fish, crustaceans, insects, frogs, and mollusks, and pairs well with large catfish.

tigerBarb.descrp: This fish from Southeast Asia, growing up to 3 inches, can lay up to 1,000 eggs in a single day, thrives at 24°C-28°C, and feeds on algae and blood worms.

tigerShark.descrp: Similar to the Albino Tiger Shark, this fish from Thailand and Vietnam gives birth to live offspring, grows up to 2 feet, thrives at 20°C-28°C, and feeds on algae and blood worms.

tilapia.descrp: Tilapia, known for their rapid growth, grow up to 2 feet, originate from Africa, thrive at 27°C-30°C, and feed on algae and blood worms.

baronet.descrp: One of the stunning butterflies. As winter sets in me I slowly disappear and interestingly will reappear in the summer months.

tailedJay.descrp: Is a vibrant green and black butterfly found in South and Southeast Asia, known for its rapid flight and tropical habitat.

blueMormon.descrp: It is the "state butterfly" of the Indian state of Maharashtra. With a wingspan of 120-150 mm, it is the fourth largest butterfly of India.

bluePansy.descrp: The Blue Pansy has been declared as the state butterfly of the union territory of Jammu and Kashmir in India.

commander.descrp: Moduza procris, the commander, sometimes included in the genus Limenitis, is a medium-sized, strikingly coloured brush-footed butterfly found in South Asia and Southeast Asia.

bluebottle.descrp: The common bluebottle or blue triangle in Australia, is a species of swallowtail butterfly that is found in East, South and Southeast Asia, as well as eastern Australia.

commonLeopard.descrp: The common leopard or spotted rustic, is a sun-loving butterfly of the nymphalid or brush-footed butterfly family.

commonPierrot.descrp: The Common Pierrot, is a small butterfly found in South Asia that belongs to the lycaenids, or blues family.

crimsonRose.descrp: Is a large swallowtail butterfly belonging to the genus Pachliopta (roses) of the red-bodied swallowtails. It is recorded as a species of "Least Concern (LC)" by IUCN.

limeButterfly.descrp: Is an economically important pest whose larval forms cause serious damage to citrus family by devouring the foliage heavily during the later stages of their development. The lime Swallowtail, PDL is sometimes called the chequered or citrus Swallowtail.

peacockPansy.descrp: Is a butterfly known for its striking eye spots on its wings, resembling a peacock feather! These eye spots serve a fascinating purpose—they help scare away potential predators by mimicking the eyes of larger animals.

striperTiger.descrp: While it is a strong flier, it never flies rapidly or high. It has stronger and faster strokes than the plain tiger. These butterflies migrate seasonally between the Western Ghats and the Eastern plains of Southern India.

openSciencePark.name: Open Science Park
openSciencePark.text: where innovation thrives, collaboration sparks, and the future of science unfolds!

planetarium.name: Planetarium
planetarium.text: where the stars come alive, and the mysteries of the universe unfold before your eyes!

scienceCentre.name: Science Centre
scienceCentre.text: where hands-on exhibits and interactive experiments bring science to life for all ages!

naturalHistoryMuseum.name: Natural History Museum
naturalHistoryMuseum.text: where the secrets of plants, animals, and ancient history come alive—journey through time as you uncover fossils and the roots of life itself.

butterflyGarden.name: Butterfly Garden
butterflyGarden.text: where delicate wings flutter through vibrant gardens, bringing nature's beauty to life!

nava.name: Nava
nava.text: where the charm of a vintage ship meets exquisite dining. Sail through flavors, as you dine in a timeless maritime ambiance.

aquarium.name: Aquarium
aquarium.text: Dive into an underwater world of wonder, where vibrant marine life and fascinating ocean discoveries await you!

motherNature.name: Mother Nature
motherNature.text: an awe-inspiring symbol of life's harmony, nurturing the earth and all its creatures with her eternal wisdom and grace.

conservationArea.name: Conservation Area
conservationArea.text: where untouched landscapes and vibrant wildlife create a peaceful sanctuary for nature lovers.

exhibitionCentre.name: Exhibition Centre
exhibitionCentre.text: a stunning architectural marvel resembling a lotus. Known as the Exhibition Center where unforgettable exhibitions and vibrant activities come to life.

bigButterflyMonth.title: Big Butterfly Month
bigButterflyMonth.description: This special time is dedicated to raising awareness and appreciation for the beautiful and vital role butterflies play in our ecosystem. We invite you to be part of the excitement with guided butterfly walks, interactive workshops, and fun activities for all ages. Explore our garden's butterfly habitats, learn about conservation efforts, and discover how you can contribute to preserving these incredible pollinators. If you are a butterfly lover like us then don't forget to book your tickets (Limited tickets**)

butterflyMagic.title: Experience the Magic of Butterfly
butterflyMagic.description: Spot a kaleidoscope of butterfly varieties in vibrant hues!

diverseFlowers.title: Diverse Flower Varieties
diverseFlowers.description: Explore our stunning collection of rare and exotic flowers from around the globe.

fruitsAndVeggies.title: Discover Fruits and Veggies
fruitsAndVeggies.description: Unlock the power of nature by learning about the healing benefits of different fruits, veggies, and seeds!

desertDiscovery.title: Discover the Desert
desertDiscovery.description: From towering giants to tiny wonders, explore the diverse world of cacti!

aquariumExploration.title: Explore Aquarium
aquariumExploration.description: Embark on an underwater adventure and explore the vibrant world of the aquarium

chandrapurHistory.title: Rich History of Chandrapur
chandrapurHistory.description: Unlock the rich history of Chandrapur and explore its cultural heritage and ancient landmarks

uniqueBirds.title: Unique Varieties of birds
uniqueBirds.description: Spot a dazzling variety of birds in their natural splendor!

group.name: Group
group.text: Gather your friends, family, or colleagues and immerse yourselves in a shared experience of nature! Whether it's a corporate retreat, a family reunion, or a gathering with friends, our botanical garden offers group tours and customized activities to make your visit unforgettable. Enjoy guided tours, workshops, and team-building activities designed to bring people together while learning about the wonders of the plant world.

students.name: Students
students.text: Our botanical garden is the perfect outdoor classroom for curious minds! Students can explore a living laboratory filled with vibrant ecosystems, rare species, and sustainable gardening practices. Our educational programs, guided by experts, align with school curriculum and provide a hands-on, interactive learning experience. From botany to environmental science, students will leave inspired and informed.

seniorCitizens.name: Senior Citizens
seniorCitizens.text: Embrace nature's tranquility at your own pace. Our garden offers peaceful walking paths, shaded benches, and serene settings perfect for reflection and relaxation. Seniors can take a walk into our medicinal and sit, relax inside our open butterfly gardens tours or simply enjoy the beauty of the gardens. It's a place to unwind, reconnect with nature, and find solace in the rhythms of the natural world.

kids.name: Kids
kids.text: Watch your little ones' imaginations come to life! The garden is a world of discovery, with plenty of fun and interactive experiences tailored just for kids. From scavenger hunts to hands-on workshops, our children's zone is designed to spark curiosity and a love for nature. Adventure awaits at every turn—perfect for young explorers eager to learn about plants and ecosystems.

influencers.name: Influencers
influencers.text: Looking for the perfect backdrop for your content? Our botanical garden offers breathtaking scenery, vibrant flowers, and picturesque landscapes that will take your social media feed to the next level. Whether you're shooting lifestyle content, promoting sustainability, or simply capturing beautiful moments, there's no shortage of inspiration here. Tag us in your photos for a chance to be featured!

natureEnthusiasts.name: Nature Enthusiasts
natureEnthusiasts.text: Dive deeper into your love for nature. Our botanical garden is a haven for plant lovers, offering a rich variety of rare species, themed gardens, and seasonal blooms. Join specialized tours, attend horticulture workshops, or simply wander through our diverse landscapes. Whether you're an avid gardener or just enjoy being in the presence of greenery, there's something here to feed your passion for the natural world.
